--- title: "Bradford 10K" date: "2011-03-19" author: "Adrian Joseph" image: https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-03-19_BRADFORD_10K/img/00.png categories: [race report, run] format: html lightbox: match: auto effect: fade desc-position: right loop: false --- ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-03-19_BRADFORD_10K/img/00.png) My first solo 10K. Bradford is a town in Yorkshire, UK. I rode my motorbike there since there was a big car park near the race start, and it always easy to park a motorbike anyway. There was no real changing room, so it was a good thing that I was wearing my running gear under motorbike outfit. On the plus side, the baggage area was inside the town hall, a stereotypical old English large building fully carpeted, with a grand wooden and marble staircase, and old portraits of distinguished gentlemen everywhere. The race itself was flat and fast, with a long stretch to the finish, even a bit downhill. I remember gathering all my renaming strength and sprinting to the finish line, a move that became an hallmark of my races later on and that I was using all the time to try to get past someone I was trying to chase down for the whole race. ## Summary ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {layout-ncol=4} ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-03-19_BRADFORD_10K/img/00.png){ width="100" group="hi" } ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/blogs_josa/sport_small/2011-03-19_BRADFORD_10K/img/02.jpg){ width="100" group="hi" } :::
